intro: Ottosonderia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. Ottosonderia species typically grow as compact, evergreen shrubs or herbs, often with hairy stems and leaves. The flowers are usually borne on terminal spikes and are adapted for pollination by birds or insects. They are popular ornamental plants due to their attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
